greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n-th reduced triangular number: n*(n+1)/{2^k} where 2^k is the largest power of 2 that divides product n*(n+1).
comment: The largest odd divisor of n-th triangular number.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A000265(n) * A000265(n+1). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 20 2009
mathematica: Table[tri = n*(n + 1)/2; tri/2^IntegerExponent[tri, 2], {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Oct 28 2013 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 14 2002
